thread.title: Sutton United fans queue for nearly FIVE HOURS for Arsenal tickets proving FA Cup magic is alive and well
thread.title_full: Sutton United fans queue for nearly FIVE HOURS for Arsenal tickets proving FA Cup magic is alive and well

author: Aaron Flanagan
title: Sutton United fans queue for nearly FIVE HOURS for Arsenal tickets proving FA Cup magic is alive and well
text:
Sport Sutton United fans queue for nearly FIVE HOURS for Arsenal tickets proving FA Cup magic is alive and well Sutton supporters descended on Gander Green Lane to secure their place on the terraces for the historic cup tie Share Fans queued for tickets around Gander Green Lane (Photo: @LhandySME/Twitter) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Hundreds of football fans stood in blustery winds for nearly FIVE hours to secure tickets to Sutton United's historic FA Cup tie with Arsenal. 
Temperatures plummeted as low as minus one at Sutton's Gander Green Lane home, where tickets went on sale to regular fans on Sunday morning. 
Supporters queued right around the pitch and back out into the car park in a bid to get their hands on their golden ticket to the club's biggest day. 
Over 5,000 fans are expected to cram into the Borough Sports Ground, which has an artificial 3G surface, for the Monday night clash on February 20. 
Sutton chairman Bruce Elliott had the unenviable task of telling regular fans that only one ticket would be issued per season ticket. 
But the brave-faced club veteran was amicable in responsive when answering the concerns of those queuing. 
It was initially suggested that Sutton could move the fixture away from their home ground and play it at nearby Crystal Palace. Fans gathered at Gander Green Lane for tickets (Photo: @LhandySME/Twitter) Supporters queued right around the stadium (Photo: @LhandySME/Twitter) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
